DataElement.preferredName: Human Papillomavirus Transforming Protein E6 E7 mRNA in situ Hybridization Staining Method Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text response indicating whether Human Papillomavirus E6/E7 status was assessed using an in situ hybridization (ISH) assay.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Papillomavirus Transforming Protein E6 Protein E7, Human Papillomavirus Type 16 Human Papillomavirus mRNA in situ Hybridization Staining Method Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Binds to and promotes degradation of p53 protein resulting in disruption of cell cycle regulation._Protein E7 (98 aa, ~11 kDa) is encoded by the human papillomavirus type 16 E7 gene. This protein is involved in the modulation of the activity of both retinoblastoma protein and histone deacetylases in the infected host cell, which is associated with viral genome replication and host cell transformation._Any RNA molecule that is the product of transcription of a human papillomavirus gene and contains coding information that can be translated into the amino acid sequence of a protein._In Situ Hybridization staining is an immunohistochemistry staining procedure which allows the demonstration of specific nucleic acid sequences (genes) in their cellular environment. The DNA sequence in the host cell is detected by hybridization with a biotin-labeled cDNA probe. Used for detecting protein and gene expression, determining tissue specificity, and localizing genes and proteins within tissue samples._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Papillomavirus Transforming Protein E6 Protein E7, Human Papillomavirus Type 16 Human Papillomavirus mRNA
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Binds to and promotes degradation of p53 protein resulting in disruption of cell cycle regulation.:Protein E7 (98 aa, ~11 kDa) is encoded by the human papillomavirus type 16 E7 gene. This protein is involved in the modulation of the activity of both retinoblastoma protein and histone deacetylases in the infected host cell, which is associated with viral genome replication and host cell transformation.:Any RNA molecule that is the product of transcription of a human papillomavirus gene and contains coding information that can be translated into the amino acid sequence of a protein.

Concepts.definition: Binds to and promotes degradation of p53 protein resulting in disruption of cell cycle regulation.

Protein E7 (98 aa, ~11 kDa) is encoded by the human papillomavirus type 16 E7 gene. This protein is involved in the modulation of the activity of both retinoblastoma protein and histone deacetylases in the infected host cell, which is associated with viral genome replication and host cell transformation.
Any RNA molecule that is the product of transcription of a human papillomavirus gene and contains coding information that can be translated into the amino acid sequence of a protein.

Property.preferredName: in situ Hybridization Staining Method Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: In Situ Hybridization staining is an immunohistochemistry staining procedure which allows the demonstration of specific nucleic acid sequences (genes) in their cellular environment. The DNA sequence in the host cell is detected by hybridization with a biotin-labeled cDNA probe. Used for detecting protein and gene expression, determining tissue specificity, and localizing genes and proteins within tissue samples.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: A staining procedure which detects and indicates the location of specific nucleic acid sequences in a tissue or cellular sample. The DNA or RNA sequence of interest in the host cell is detected by hybridization with a labeled cDNA, RNA or modified nucleic acid-containing probe.
Executed and carried through to completion.
